thread.title: Oman- NBO pulls out, leaving Al Omaniya last firm standing in race for United Finance
thread.title_full: Oman- NBO pulls out, leaving Al Omaniya last firm standing in race for United Finance | MENAFN.COM

author: Muscat Daily
title: Oman- NBO pulls out, leaving Al Omaniya last firm standing in race for United Finance
text:
(MENAFN - Muscat Daily) National Bank of Oman (NBO) became the latest to drop its bid for acquiring United Finance Co after Bank Nizwa pulled out from the race in May. NBO's exit now leaves Al Omaniya Financial Services as the only contender for the non-banking finance company. In May United Finance had invited all three suitors to participate in a bidding process for acquisition. After Bank Nizwa rejected the proposal Al Omaniya and NBO confirmed their interest in the bidding process.
'After careful consideration NBO now wishes to confirm that it will not be pursuing this transaction further and would like to express their regret' NBO said in a filing with the Muscat Securities Market (MSM) on Tuesday.
In a separate disclosure on Tuesday Al Omaniya said it has submitted a non-binding indicative offer for the acquisition of United Finance.
'We are pleased to inform that we have submitted a non-binding indicative offer for 100 per cent acquisition of United Finance as requested by them' said Aftab Patel CEO of Al Omaniya Financial Services.
United Finance on Tuesday confirmed that it received a written non-binding indicative offer from Al Omaniya to acquire 100 per cent of the shares in United Finance. 'The matter is receiving the board's attention and further announcement in this regard shall be made in due course as appropriate' United Finance said.
In February Bank Nizwa Oman's first fully-fledged Islamic bank was the first to propose a strategic merger with United Finance which was followed by rival offers from Al Omaniya in March and NBO in May.
United Finance had recently appointed KPMG to provide financial advisory services for the proposed acquisition.
United Finance shares dropped 2.67 per cent on Tuesday.
United Finance posted a net profit of RO1.13mn in the first quarter of this year compared with RO1.11mn in the same period last year. The company's loan book grew to RO115.2mn at the end of the first three months of this year.
Al Omaniya's loan book stood at RO239mn at the end of the first quarter against RO224mn in the same period last year. The company continues to maintain its position as the largest NBFC in terms of asset  size net worth market capitalisation net profit and provisioning cover for non-performing loans.
